newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Gateway volatility drops.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Gateway volatility drops.

text.p: Implied volatility in Gateway 2000 Inc options dropped sharply as the stock recovered from an early drop to trade higher in afternoon action, traders said Wednesday.
Late Tuesday, the computer maker said it expected second quarter revenues to be about flat with the first quarter and attributed the outlook to weaker-than-expected demand early in the quarter.
Gateway shares, which fell to 29-5/8 in after hours trading Tuesday, were up 1-5/8 at 31-7/8 on 7.65 million shares in consolidated trading Wednesday afternoon.
In New York Stock Exchange trading, Gateway was down 2-7/8 at 31-7/8 after falling to 30-3/4 off the opening. Turnover topped 5.45 million shares.
One options trader in Chicago said his firm had traded a good deal of Gateway options, with order flows fairly balanced between calls and puts.
He added that some investors were exiting June positions and rolling out to July and farther-dated options. The June series expires at the end of the week.

"What's happening is volatility's starting to decline," said a Gateway options market maker at the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE). "A lot of news has been out over the last few days and the stock has been very volatile."
He said volatilities in Gateway options, which typically hover around the 60 area, had spiked toward 90 recently but were now back down to around 65.
"The anticipation is for less volatile times in the near future," the market maker said. "So we have option sellers."
The most active Gateway option was the June 35 put, which traded 4,000 contracts all on the Pacific Exchange (PCX).

After that, the July 35 call was most active, with total volume of about 2,775 contracts. The June 32-1/2 call traded 1,550 and the June 30 put traded 1,375. The June 30 call traded roughly 1,315 contracts.
Gateway options trade on the CBOE, the PCX and the American Stock Exchange (AMEX).
In other trading, volatility in Oracle Corp also declined after the software company reported fiscal fourth quarter earnings late Tuesday, traders said.
Oracle shares were down 2-15/16 at 50-5/16 on turnover of more than 10 million shares in late action.
Traders said Oracle's $0.54 per share profits were in line with most estimates but fell short of optimistic forecasts.
Pat Hickey at LETCO in Chicago said volatilities in the June and July series declined significantly after the earnings.
One model showed June and July volatilities ranging from the low 40s to about 60.

"We're not really seeing any kind of directional paper," he said of options activity. He added that trading was relatively quiet Tuesday also, with no large bets on whether the earnings would be bullish or bearish for the stock.
